result.execSummary:
The defendant Billie Jo Bernhardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent to include Anger Management and Domestic Abuse.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol.  Absolute Sobriety.  Random UAs.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant Billie Jo Bernhardt appeared by video means with Attorney ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  State request cash bond w/ conditions.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Attorney ORourke request signature bond.  Past criminal history should not result in cash bond.  Holds valid occup. DL.  Able to reinstate DL in August.  Employed full time.  Court reenforces bond conditions from other cases.  Has not yet applied.  Attorney Muter previously represented.  Time limits waived.  $250.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:    Not to oper MV w/out valid DL.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Return date scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
